text:
He plotted his escape to America. 

“Let them do their worst!” he laughed. 

He glanced at the door. 

“Have they set a watch?” 

He grabbed a half bottle of beer. 

He gulped it down, feeling flames subside. 

A pleasant shiver ran down his spine. 

He lay back, pulling the quilt tight. 

Sleep came, deep and refreshing. 

Footsteps stirred him awake. 

Razumihin stood in the doorway. 

“Ah, you are not asleep!” he said. 

“Bring in the parcel!” 

“What time is it?” Raskolnikov asked, uneasy.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, feeling ill and disoriented, contemplates escaping while experiencing a mix of discomfort and drowsiness before falling into a deep sleep.
